feed.title: Mato Baltica | Projects
feed.subtitle: nexus for the critical study of Baltic cinemas and broader regional culture

entry.title: Baltic Cinemas Research Resources
entry.content:
Baltic Cinemas Research Resources

Introduction

Estonia ğŸ‡ªğŸ‡ª

Film Institutions

  • Estonian Film Institute
  • Film Estonia

Film Archives and Collections

  • Estonian Film Archive
    • Mediateque
    • Virtual Reading Room
  • Tallinn University Media Archive

Databases and VOD platforms

  • Eesti Filmi Andmebaas
  • Arkaader
  • ERR
  • ERR-archive
  • Anthill â€“ vast collection of Estonian mostly Soviet era films (interface in Russian)
  • 101 Estonian films (based on the book by Tristan PriimÃ¤gi) on NETIKINO
  • Estonian Animation from Tallinn film
  • Animation from Eesti Joonisfilm
  • Estonian Shorts

Film Festivals

  • Tallinn Black Nights Film Festival (PÃ–FF)
    • PÃ–FF Shorts
    • Just Film
    • Womenâ€™s Nights Film Festival (NÃ–FF)
  • PÃ¤rnu Documentary and Science Film Festival
  • DocPoint Tallinn â€“ a satellite of the Helsinki DocPoint festival
  • Tartu Love Film Festival â€œTartuffâ€
  • The Haapsalu Horror & Fantasy Film Festival (HÃ•FF)
  • Matsalu Nature Film Festival (MAFF)

Film Museums

  • Estonian Film Museum (Ajaloomuuseum)
  • The National Archivesâ€™ permanent exhibition

Film Studios

  • Tallinnfilm â€“ dissolved, film restorations and distribution
  • Eesti Telefilm â€“ on hold
  • List from Film Institute
  • Eesti Joonisfilm

Film Education

  • Baltic Film, Media and Arts School at Tallinn University
  • Estonian Academy of Arts (EKA)

Creative unions and representative organisations

  • Filmmakers Association
  • Documentary Guild
  • Film Directors Guild
  • Screenwritersâ€™ Guild
  • Animation Association
  • Society of Cinematographers
  • The Estonian Association of Audiovisual Authors
  • Film Journalistsâ€™ Association
  • Actorsâ€™ Union

Film periodicals and publications

  • National Library of Estonia
    • Digar (Digital archive)
  • Teater.Muusika.Kino
  • Sirp
  • Baltic Film Magazine
  • Estonian Film Magazine

Miscellaneous

  • Ministry of Culture
    • Creative Persons and Associations Act
    • Copyright Act
  • The Estonian National Culture Foundation
  • Statistics

Latvia ğŸ‡±ğŸ‡»

State Film Institutions

  • National Film Centre of Latvia
  • Ministry of Culture

Film Archives, Collections, and Databases

  • Latvian State Archive of Audiovisual Documents
    • See, Hear Latvia! â€“ Digital archive of audiovisual, photo and audio documents of the Latvian State Archives of Audiovisual Documents.
  • Riga Film Museum Archive
  • Filmas.lv -en â€“ Rich collection of restored films (mainly from the Soviet era) available worldwide
  • Filmas.lv -lv â€“ The Latvian Section provides access to a majority of fiction, documentary, and animated films produced in Latvia. It is accessible from Latvia and partially from Latvian libraries.
  • latfilma.lv â€“ The content of this abandoned site hosted by Latvian Filmmakersâ€™ Union was integrated into filmas.lv and the NKC. However, you can still find some original articles by visiting the site via the Web Archive.
  • National Library of Latvia
    • Digital periodicals collection â€“ mainly in Latvian and Russian

VOD platforms and streaming services

access from Latvia

  • Tet+
  • LMT ViedtelevÄ«zija
  • Go3

worldwide

  • RePlay â€“ Some of the films are geolocked
  • DaFilms â€“ Latvian section
  • ArtDocMedia â€“ filtered by :produced_in_Latvia
  • Latvian films available to watch for free and Latvian movies on demand â€“ Most useful lists of Latvian films are available online. The lists are made and curated by Dita Karauze. Check her other listsâ€”a thematic collection of Latvian cinemaâ€”using the hashtag #LVKIno.
  • Latvian experimental film â€“ Another Letterboxd list features a curated collection from the Baltic Analog Lab.

Film Festivals

  • Riga International Film Festival â€“ successor of â€œArsenalsâ€
  • 2ANNAS â€“ Riga International Short Film Festival
  • Baltic Sea Documentary Forum
  • ArtDocFest â€“ A documentary film festival formerly based in Russia has relocated to Latvia. Their site also hosts a rich digital cinemateque where many films are available, either for free or with a subscription.
  • European Documentary Film Symposiums â€“ Active from 1977 until the 2000s, this forum is now attempting a revival at ArtDocFest.
  • [Lielais Kristaps] â€“ National Film Award, previously National Film Festival

Film Museums

  • Riga Film Museum

Film Studios

  • Riga Film Studio â€“Formerly one of the biggest film studios in the USSR, it had an extraordinary documentary branch. Currently, it deals with preservation and digitalization.
  • VFS films â€“ produced â€œThe Jumpâ€, â€œBridges of Timeâ€, â€œUkrainian Sheriffsâ€ and many others.
  • Juris Podnieks Studio â€“ originally founded by Juris Podnieks, is now headed by Antra Cilinska, documentary filmmaker, producer, editor, Jurisâ€™ long-time collaborator
  • GILDE â€“ run by Romualdas Pipars and Baiba Urbane
  • Dream Well Studio â€“ independent animation production company. Founded by Gints Zilbalodis.
  • Rija Films â€“ has a section of its films available on demand
  • Locomotive â€“ In addition to film production, the studio conducts outstanding restorations of Latvian film classics
  • List of film production companies and studios at latfima

Film Education

  • National Film School of the Latvian Academy of Culture
  • Baltic Analog Lab film school
  • The Art Academy of Latvia
  • RISEBA

Creative unions and representative organisations

  • Filmmakers Union
  • Latvian Guild of Cinematographers
  • Film Producersâ€™ Association
  • Animation Association

Film periodicals and publications

  • Culture Crossroads â€“ an international peer-reviewed journal published by theÂ Institute of Arts and Cultural Studies of the Latvian Academy of Culture.
  • Kino Raksti
  • Latvijas arhÄ«vi â€“ publishes articles on archives

Miscellaneous

  • Tue Steen MÃ¼llerâ€™s blog â€“ Tue is a legend in the documentary world, known for participating in and writing about many European film festivals. He is also a valued friend of the Latvian documentary film scene. His blog is a wonderful source for news and reviews concerning Latvian documentaries, filmmakers, and events.

Lithuania ğŸ‡±ğŸ‡¹

Film Institutions

  • Lithuanian Film Centre
  • Vilnius Film Office
  • Kaunas Film Office
  • Meno Avylis â€“ This wonderful film and educational NGO preserves Lithuanian film heritage, among its many other activities.

Film Archives, Databases, and Digital Cinemateques

  • Lithuanian Central State Archives
    • Digital Archive E-Kinas
    • National Library of Lithuania
  • LRT mediateque â€“ huge collection of documentaries and TV programs
  • sinemateka.lt â€“ Lithuanian films restored by Meno Avilys. The Cinemateques also has a physical collection of films and publications at GoÅ¡tauto St. 2, Vilnius
  • INFONDAS â€“ database and streaming platform for Lithuanian films
  • Lithuanian Shorts

VOD and streaming

  • Kino pavasaris at Telia.lt

Film Festivals

  • Vilnius International Film Festival â€” Kinopavasaris
  • International Vilnius Documentary Film Festival
  • European Film Forum â€œScanoramaâ€
  • Vilnius Short Film FEstival
  • IFF â€œBaltijos bangaâ€
  • International Experimental Film and Arts Festival â€œSuspaustas laikasâ€
  • Vilnius Queer Film Festival â€œKreivÄ—sâ€

Film Museums

  • Lithuanian Theatre, Music and Cinema Museum
  • Jonas Mekas Visual Art Center
  • MO Museum â€“ â€“ mediateque and library
  • National Gallery of Art â€“ mediateque and library

Film Studios

  • Lithuanian Film Studios â€“ not quite active
  • Nominum â€“ founded by Arunas Matelis
  • Studija Kinema â€“ founded in 1989 by director Sharunas Bartas
  • More companies â€“ Lithuanian Film Industry Guide published by LFC

Film Education

  • National Film School at LMTA
  • Skalvija Film Academy
  • Meno Avilysâ€™ educational programs

Creative unions and representative organisations

  • Lithuanian filmmakers union
  • Lithuanian association of cinematographers
  • Independent Producers Association
  • Association of Lithuanian film culture
  • Animation Association
  • Alliance of cinema auteurs

Film periodicals and publications

  • Kinas
  • Literatura ir menas
  • 7md
  • 15min.lt
  • Lituanus
  • Database â€œLituanistikaâ€

Other

  • The Baltic Sea Region Film History Conference
  • Baltic Screen Media Review
  • Central and Eastern European Online Library
  • Apparatus â€“ journal that deals with film, media and digital cultures of Eastern, Central and South-Eastern Europe
  • Baltic Worlds â€“ scholarly journal published by the Centre for Baltic and East European Studies at SÃ¶dertÃ¶rn University
  • AABS â€“ The Association for the Advancement of Baltic Studies
  • Journal of Baltic Studies
  • KinoKultura â€“ publishes articles and reviews on the cinemas of regions and nations, including special issues on Estonia, Latvia, and others.
  • Tuna journal â€“ issued by the National Archives of Estonia
  • East European Film Bulletin)
